Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Clamor means 'demand or ask for something loudly.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Pandemonium means 'chaos or confusion.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Towering means 'very tall.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: A Memento is 'something given or kept or a reminder of a person, place, or experience.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: When you reassure someone, you make the person feel less worried. You calm the person and given the person courage or confidence.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Tattered means 'torn and ragged.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Whiz means 'move very fast.' Some things that whiz make a buzzing or hissing sound.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Squirm means 'wiggle or twist your body from side to side, usually because you are bored or uncomfortable.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Rap means 'tap or hit something sharply (forcefully) and quickly' rap is also a 'type of music in which words are spoken in time to music which a steady beat.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Snap means 'speak sharply or angrily.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: When something is likely, it probably will happen or is probably true.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Unlikely means 'not likely.' When something is likely, it probably will not happen or is probably not true.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Bustle mean 'rush or hurry in an excited. noisy, or busy way.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Volunteer means 'offer to do something or help someone by choice.' When you volunteer, you do something because you want to do it. You do not expect pay or a reward.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Debris is the 'scattered pieces of something that has been thrown away, broken, or destroyed.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Devastate mean 'destroy or badly damage.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Ruckus mean 'noisy confusion or excitement.' Something unexpected or frightening can cause a ruckus.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Lounge means 'sit or lie in a lazy or relaxed way.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Swerve means 'change directions quickly, usually to avoid something.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Flick means 'move, or make something move, with a quick, sudden motion.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Speedy menas 'fast.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Utter means 'say something or make some sort of sound.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Whoop means 'shout from excitement.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Plop menas 'sit down heavily or put something down heavily.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Flutter means 'wave or flap repidly.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Clutch means 'grab or hold onto something tightly.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Dodge means 'move quickly to avoid someone or something.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Heartbreaking means 'very sad or upsetting.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Fury means 'great anger.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Bewildered means 'confused or puzzled.' When you are bewildered, you are not sure what to do or think.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Floppy means 'soft and hanging down loosely.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Recall means 'remember.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: When things clatter, they bang together or rattle noisily.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: A disaster is an 'event such as a fire, flood, or storm that causes a lot of damange or suffering.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: A celebration is a 'happy event held to honer a special occasion.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Retrieve means 'bring or get something back.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Doubtful means 'uncertaiin or unsure.' When you are doubtful, you are full of doubt.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Nifty means 'very good, clever, or useful.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Ghastly means 'horrible.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Dazzle means 'amaze or impress.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Quiver means 'tremble or shake.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Command means 'order someone to do something.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Particularly means 'especially or mainly.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Speechless means 'unable to speak because you are shocked, surprised, or very angry.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Reunite means 'come together again after being separated.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Cross means 'annoyed and angry.' Cross also means 'go from one side of something to another.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Savory means 'pleasant to smell or taste.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Realize means 'become aware of something or understand something that you did not understand before.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: If you are reluctant to do something, you do not want to do it.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Word: have eyes in the back of your head
Week.Meening: If you have eyes in the back of your head, you seem to be aware of everything that is happening around you--even things you cannot see.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: If a place is cluttered, it is messy. There are things scattered here, there, and everyware.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Handy means 'useful or easy to use.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Whoosh means 'move very fast.' When something whooshes, it makes a rushing or hissing sound.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: If you have a change of heart, you change your opinion or the way you feel about something.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Obstinate means 'stubbon." If you are obstinate, you are unwilling to change your mind about something.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Immature means 'childish or silly.' An immature person acts like someone much younger.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Mature means 'grown up or adult. A mature person is sensible and reasonable. He or she is not being immature or childish.

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Fantasize means 'think about or imagine something that is pleasant or exciting but inlikely to happen in real life.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Barricade means 'block the way by putting up barriers or obstacles.'

Week.Name: anish
Week.Meening: Reconsider means 'think again about a decision.' Sometimes when you reconsider a decision, you change your mind.
